title: The Development of a Microscopy Outreach Program and How to Raise the Next Generation of Material Scientists for Semiconductor Technology
content: Semiconductors act as the cornerstone of almost all modern marvels, but the material science skillset will need to continue to grow with the demand for the devices themselves. The job outlook for material scientists is projected to increase by 6% by 2032, which is close to double the projected average for all professions[1]. For this reason, it is not only important but necessary to involve students at all levels in science and expose them to semiconductors from an early stage. Introducing young learners to the wonders of microscopy and semiconductors opens a direct path to careers in materials science.
